intro: Tofieldia borealis, commonly known as the northern tofieldia, is a flowering plant native to arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Xanthorrhoeaceae family, which includes plants commonly known as golden club. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and is adapted to cold climates with short growing seasons. It produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Tofieldia borealis is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and is often found in tundra and mountainous environments.
